briefTitle: Multi-Center Study of New Medications to Treat Vaginal Infections

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* A clinical diagnosis of vaginal infection that is confirmed by laboratory testing and:
* Capable of providing written informed consent or assent
* Currently not menstruating and not anticipating menses during treatment
* If heterosexually active, subject must be post-menopausal for â‰¥ 1 year, surgically sterile, or practicing an acceptable form of birth control
* Negative pregnancy test
* Other criteria as identified in the protocol

Exclusion Criteria:

* Other infectious causes of vulvovaginitis
* Subject has recently used, or is expected to require the concomitant use of prohibited medications/products
* Nursing mother
* Use of any investigational drug within 30 days of enrollment
* History of hypersensitivity to any ingredient/component of the formulations
* Other criteria as identified in the protocol

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinical Cure as Assessed by the Investigator at the Test-of-cure Visit
outcomeMeasures.description: The percentage of participants with clinical cure in each arm was compared. A clinical cure is defined as the resolution of all signs and symptoms attributable to vulvovaginal candidiasis

outcomeMeasures.title: Improvement/Cure of Individual and Cumulative Signs, Symptoms and Criteria for the Infection
outcomeMeasures.description: Signs (edema, erythema, excoriation) and symptoms (itching, burning irritation) were each scored as absent (0), mild (1), moderate (2) or severe (3). A total sign score of 0-9 and total symptom score of 0-9 were combined for a total possible combined sign and symptom score of 0-18. Total median combined sign and symptom severity score was compared between arms at the test of cure visit. Lower scores at day 7-14 indicate improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mycologic Cure
outcomeMeasures.description: Vaginal swabs were cultured for Candida species in a laboratory. A positive culture indicates presence of vaginal yeast and a negative culture indicates absence of vaginal yeast. A negative culture indicates mycologic cure.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Reporting Complete Resolution of Symptoms by Test of Cure Visit
outcomeMeasures.description: Subjects reported if symptoms completely resolved and the date of resolution. The percentage of participants reporting complete resolution of symptoms was compared between arms.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Adverse events were collected at study visits, from subject diaries and from spontaneous reports
